definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: It's located in Tennessee and North Carolina.
sentences.chinese: 大烟山国家公园位于田纳西州和北卡罗来纳州交界处。

sentences.english: Pot smokers claim it heightens their awareness.
sentences.chinese: 抽大烟的人声称，抽烟能够提高他们的意识力。

sentences.english: Tom is a chain smoker, consuming at least five packs a day.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆是个大烟鬼，每天要抽5包的烟。
几个大烟囱在排出浓烟。

sentences.english: Baba and Rahim Khan were smoking pipes and sipping brandy when I came in.
sentences.chinese: 我进去的时候，爸爸和拉辛汗边抽大烟边喝白兰地。

sentences.english: We had to climb that chimney to fight climate change.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须得爬上那个大烟囱来抵制气候的变化。

sentences.english: You will know the house by its tall chimneys.
sentences.chinese: 看到那些大烟囱你就会认出那所房子。

sentences.english: Clouds obscure a valley in Great Smoky Mountains National Park.
sentences.chinese: 云雾笼罩着大烟山国家公园的一个山谷。

sentences.english: The sun was low in the sky and the huge chimney in the distance cast a lengthening shadow across the streets and houses.
sentences.chinese: 夕阳西下，远处大烟囱长长的影子落在街道和房屋上。

sentences.english: To print this someone must be smoking something pretty powerful.
sentences.chinese: 发表这篇文章的人肯定是抽大烟了。

sentences.english: The magistrate was an opium smoker and let Li do all the work.
sentences.chinese: 县长是个大烟鬼，什么事都让李去干。

sentences.english: Tony has become a chimney since his G. F dumped him.
sentences.chinese: 托尼自从被女友甩了后，变成了一个大烟鬼。

sentences.english: Ceng Nianan think great smoky Han Jinquan smoked for ten years, cant.
sentences.chinese: 曾念安认为韩金铨抽了十年大烟，不能服众。
